section.title: Axis Ant Tasks
section.p: Axis comes with Ant tasks to automate aspects of the build process inside ant. To use these tasks, you need

ol.li: The library axis-ant.jar which contains the tasks

section.title: Declaring the Tasks
section.p: To declare the tasks, set up a classpath to include the axis task JAR and all the dependent libraries. Including everything in the axis lib directory should suffice
Then use the <taskdef> declaration to declare all the tasks listed in a properties file inside the axis-ant.jar file:

section.title: Creating Java files from WSDL
section.p: The mapping elements are used to list the mappings from XML namespaces to Java packages; you can include as many as you need.

section.title: Talking to the admin service
section.p: This can be done with the <axis-admin> task.
Here the target.* properties are pulled from a properties file for the system being deployed to, so a single build file can deploy to different systems with ease.
